tn.ref: sit on David's throne
tn.text: This refers to having kingly authority, like David had. AT: "rule as king, like David before you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: listen to the word of Yahweh
tn.text: AT: "pay attention to the word of Yahweh"

tn.ref: you, and your servants, and your people
tn.text: AT: "you and your servants, and your people who live in his country"

tn.ref: who come through these gates
tn.text: These are the gates of the palace of the king. AT: "who come to visit the king"

tn.ref: the hand of the oppressor
tn.text: The word "hand" refers to the power or control of a person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Do not mistreat
tn.text: Do not treat someone badly

tn.ref: orphan
tn.text: a child who does not have parents

tn.ref: Do not ... pour out innocent blood
tn.text: AT: "Do not ... murder innocent people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: in this place
tn.text: "This place" refers to Jerusalem, or even the whole country of Judah. This does not imply that it is good to murder people in other places.

tn.ref: kings sitting on David's throne
tn.text: This refers to kings having authority like David had. AT: "kings, ruling like David before them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: riding in a chariot and on horses
tn.text: This phrase describes the kings as powerful and wealthy. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: he, his servants, and his people
tn.text: This sentence lists all who will be powerful and wealthy. AT: "he, his servants, and his people will ride into the palace on chariots and horses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: if you do not listen
tn.text: AT: "if you do not pay attention" (UDB) or "if you do not obey"

tn.ref: this is Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].

tn.ref: palace of the king of Judah
tn.text: This could also be translated as "house of the king of Judah" and refers to the family and descendants of the King of Judah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: You are like Gilead, or like the summit of Lebanon
tn.text: Yahweh is describing his good feelings toward the family and descendants of the King of Judah (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: turn you into a wilderness
tn.text: AT: "cause your cities to become empty or uninhabited" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Then many nations will pass by this city.
tn.text: AT: "Then many people from various nations will pass by this city." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: bowed down to other gods and worshiped them
tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing. The phrase "bowed down to" describes the posture that people used in worship. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: The speaker Yahweh has shifted from addressing the King of Judah and is now speaking to a general audience.

tn.ref: see the land of his birth again
tn.text: AT: "see the land of Israel again" or "see his homeland again"

tn.ref: Jehoahaz
tn.text: The name in Hebrew is "Shallum," but he is better known as Jehoahaz.

tn.ref: house
tn.text: House is being used here to describe Jehoiakim and his family. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Is this what makes you a good king, that you wanted to have boards of cedar
tn.text: AT: "Having a cedar palace does not make you a good king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Did not your father also eat and drink ... righteousness?
tn.text: AT: "King Josiah enjoyed his life ... righteousness." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Is this not what it means to know me?
tn.text: AT: "This is what it means to know me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: nothing in your eyes and heart
tn.text: "nothing in your thoughts and emotions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: unjust profit
tn.text: This is getting money by cheating or by using unfair means.

tn.ref: pouring out innocent blood
tn.text: "killing innocent people"

tn.ref: crushing of others
tn.text: "doing violence to others in order to get money"

tn.ref: Woe, my brother! ... Woe, my sister! ... Woe, master! ... Woe, majesty!
tn.text: Yahweh uses the word "Woe" several times for emphasis. He addresses the various people who would normally show great sadness when someone dies. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: He will be buried with a donkey's burial, dragged away and thrown out
tn.text: "They will bury his dead body the way they would bury a dead donkey; they will drag it away and throw it out" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Lift your voice
tn.text: AT: "Shout in Bashan"

tn.ref: Abarim mountains
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: I spoke to you when you were safe
tn.text: AT: "I spoke to you when you were doing well"

tn.ref: This was your custom
tn.text: AT: "This was your way of life"

tn.ref: you have not listened to my voice
tn.text: AT: "you have not obeyed me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: The wind will shepherd away all your shepherds
tn.text: AT: "Your leaders will be taken away" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: House of the Forest of Lebanon, you who nest among the cedars
tn.text: AT: "a palace made from the cedars of Lebanon"

tn.ref: how you will be pitied when the labor pains of anguish come on you like childbirth
tn.text: AT: "you will be pitied because of your pain"

tn.ref: As I live
tn.text: AT: "Surely"

tn.ref: even if you, Jehoiachin ... were the signet on my right hand, I would tear you off
tn.text: AT: "Even if you, Jehoiachin ... were the signet on my right hand, I would tear you off from my hand" or "Jehoiachin ... even if you were the king whom I had chosen as an expression of my power, I would still punish you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I have given you to the hand of the ones seeking your life
tn.text: AT: "I have made it possible for the ones seeking your life to capture you"

tn.ref: this land to which they will want to return
tn.text: Refers to the land of Judah

tn.ref: Is this a despised and shattered vessel? Is this man Jehoiachin a pot that pleases no one?
tn.text: AT: "Jehoiachin is useless and no one is happy with him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Why have they thrown him and his descendants out, and have poured them out into a land that they did not know?
tn.text: AT: "The people should have removed Jehoiachin and his family from the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Land, Land, Land
tn.text: Yahweh speaks his message to all the people of the land by calling out to the land where they live. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_apostrophe]])

tn.ref: Hear the word of Yahweh
tn.text: AT: "obey the word of Yahweh"
